Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MimiTravels_TX
Reviews.Content: We were only in Venice for a few days and are so glad that we found this great hotel on Tripadvisor! Hotel Noemi is incredibly close to San Marco plaza and only a short walk to Rialto bridge. The staff was amazing and incredibly helpful! When we arrived they actually upgraded us to a deluxe room when we had only reserved an economy. The room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast was served every morning by a very sweet hotel staff and she brought us great cappucinos! I'm actually quite shocked by some of the negative reviews of this place..yes you do have to climb stairs, but if you travel in Europe (especially Venice) you should be familiar with toting your luggage as many of the best places to stay here have character and are older! If you love hotels with character, great service, and location location location...this place is perfect for you! We will definitely recommend to our friends! We did not eat at the restaurant because of other plans, but every night it seemed to be packed!

Reviews.Title: “Location!!!Price!!!Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenPK
Reviews.Content: Wow! Location was perfect! The price was even better which made this hotel a winner. The room was nice, small, but that is common in Europe in general. The breakfast was the best! We stayed in many hotels in Italy during our two week visit and this was by far the most yummy and well stocked when compared to the others. However, read the fine print : Internet is only free for the first hour. I know we didn't come to Venice to be on the internet, but when it said free internet, you expect for it to be free, the entire time. We did bring our two dogs with us (1 medium and 1 large), they were not happy and did give us a hard time, but I emailed them before we booked and told them we were coming with dogs so it shouldn't have been a surprise when we showed up with them. Anyways, it ended up not being a big deal however, the staff were very rude to us the entire trip. Overall, I would return, even with poor service because you cannot beat the price and location, just probably without the dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Location ! Location ! Location!”
Reviews.Author: sadie520
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice again this year and once again stayed at the Hotel Noemi. This boutique Hotel is located within a 2 minute walk to St. Mark's Square and a less than 10 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. The Hotel is beautifully decorated in typical Venetian style. Pay attention to the details...There is a spectacular hand blown glass hand rail as you enter the hotel on the first floor, as well as a Venetian chandelier hanging from the ceiling. Details are beautiful. Anyone who has been to Venice knows that hotels can be very pricey. The Noemi is very reasonbly priced and clean! The cost of the room includes a delicious continental breakfast, with fresh pastries, fruit, cheeses and meats. This time we stayed in a spacious room which had a queen size bed and twin bed, a period desk and armoire, and a well appointed bathroom. When you realize where you are located, there is no comparison with other hotels. You will be very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price and position”
Reviews.Author: wyndipotts
Reviews.Content: Weve stayed there 4 times now and will continue to go there. Your close to San Marco and very inexpensive. Rooms are small but very Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “OK in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: MplsJen
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights in a single room at Hotel Noemi in September 2011. I booked my room six weeks in advance of my arrival and found that Hotel Noemi's rates were 75% less than any other hotels in Venice that had available rooms. The location is great - close to all of the major sites. My single room was small, but adequate. If you're looking for a place to park your stuff and explore Venice, Hotel Noemi is fine. If, on the other hand, you're looking for a relaxing place to spend some time, I'd suggest other hotels. The room was dark and small, but clean and relatively quiet. Breakfasts were better than expected based on the reviews here, but my expectations were very low.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT beware!”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel, is the web site! Not very impressed! My husband and I were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and had planned a trip to Rome, Florence and Venice. Our first impression, like previous reviewers found us on the ground floor with luggage and no elevator to get to the reception. Overlooking this, we checked into our room, which was decorated very elegantly and what we had expected. However, later, we discovered that the sink leaked and the piece that held the shower head was broken and there were exposed wires when we used the hairdryer! This was unacceptable considering how much we were paying, compared to the other 3 star hotels that we had stayed at. We reported the problems, and the girl made note of it, however nothing was done to repair the problems. Although this is a great location, could not recommend, we were very disappointed. Also, most of the other guests that we talked to at breakfast felt the same. Found the hotel staff quite aloof and could be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but not much more...”
Reviews.Author: M0neyminder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, very close to San Marcos square and the Rialto bridge. However, there isn't much more to this. While the staff was friendly, I wouldn't say that they were helpful. We didn't even know that breakfast was included in our room cost much less what time it was served. And the rooms are tiny with very poor lighting. Bathroom was not "user friendly" and water stood in the sinks and shower without draining well. I think we may have found a better hotel with the same great location if we knew about the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christinebdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Noemi in September 2011. Our room was off the lobby and we did not feel that it was particulary noisy. It was charmingly decorated and very clean. We adored the older gentleman at the front desk and felt that most of the staff were pleasant and helpful. We stayed at the hotel during a two week trip to multiply cities. The lobby was one flight up from the street, and we did not get help with our bags, but we found that commonly during our trip. The room was small by US standards, but relatively large for Italy. The breakfast bar was also quite typical, with bread, cheese, fresh fruit, and coffee. In general, we really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend the hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: mbutterfly1977
Reviews.Content: Service very friendly, rooms tiny but pretty, location good but breakfasts you can definitely skip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Reasonable advance rates, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: uni_queue
Reviews.Content: Friendly 3* hotel, 100m from St Marks Sq and easy to find. Traditional Venetian Decor with clean modern bathroom. In a narrow street so dont expect panoramic views. Excellent base for a short break in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Close to St Mark's but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sofoula13
Reviews.Content: The hotel gives a terrible first impression because when you enter the building, youâ€™re in a space that houses nothing but a coat rack. That is because you have to go up a flight a stairs to get to the hotelâ€™s main level. If youâ€™re lucky, thatâ€™s the floor youâ€™re staying on, otherwise you might be looking at another flight of stairs to climb with your luggage; thereâ€™s no elevator in the hotel. If youâ€™re smart, you packed light in the first place since Venice is all stairs over bridges. I was lucky, one of the owners of the hotel was working at the desk when we arrived so he came down to help bring up our bags. Not that he was pleasant, but at least he helped with the bag. The hotel itself is tastefully decorated in traditional Renaissance feel, though given the tight space in Venice, everything is significantly narrower and smaller. That includes the room, which had no navigateable space to move around. We were in room 120, (220 Euro/night), which is right across from the reception check in desk and right off the breakfast area. Literally, the door of the room opened into the breakfast area. The breakfast was disappointing, there wasnâ€™t a really large selection and it wasnâ€™t really replenished wish any sort of urgency, so you basically would give up waiting for more and just make do with what was available, which was minimal meat and cheeses, croissants and minimal cereal options. There was no fresh fruit or pastry option, nor was the yogurt near edible. Surprisingly though, noise from the reception desk and breakfast areas werenâ€™t an issue (at least for me). Our roomâ€™s window was right off the street below but the window didnâ€™t let noise permeate through. As for the room, there was a wardrobe in front of us as soon as we walked into the room. Inside of the wardrobe was the safe with a key, itâ€™s not electronic unfortunately. Having somewhere to unload some clothes was greatly appreciated since there was literally no space to open two small 23â€�bags on the floor side by side. We propped one of the bags on the only available surface in the room, which was a chair for sitting. Instead it became a luggage tray! Thereâ€™s barely enough room for a small console upon which they placed the tv and that took over the entire space, basically giving us nowhere to lay down your watch or purse or cell phone. Literally there was no room in the â€˜room.â€™ There was a bed and barely enough room to move around it. Small ledges were attached to the fabric covered walls to serve as â€˜side tablesâ€™ but trust me all they could hold was a cell phone. The bathroom had better lighting than what we had experienced elsewhere in Italy, but we encountered the same problem of lack of a ledge or sink space for leaving a hairbrush, makeup bag, or a toothbrush. Every day we had to pack up like we were leaving because there was nowhere to leave our stuff spread out. The shower in the hotel was painfully small. Literally PAINFULLY small because I kept bumping my elbows into the glass and the shower door frame. I could only lift one arm at a time to shampoo my hair, which was awkward, uncomfortable and painful at times. Certainly because the room was so small and the shower space was so minimal, we both inevitable kept bumping around the corners in the room. The bed/bedroom was clean but the tight confines were frustrating. There was a Sri Lankan man working in the late evenings, Iâ€™m sorry I donâ€™t remember his name, but he was extremely nice and chatty. The best part of Hotel Noemi is certainly the proximity to San Marco. Itâ€™s right around the corner from the Piazza, which is great because thatâ€™s where most of the attractions in Venice are. That being said, next time I visit Venice, I will definitely stay either in Dorsoduro or on Lido where the actual Venetians live because San Marco is crushed with tourists, it basically only exists to service them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and cozy in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: Fokissed
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing place to stay for our first trip to Italy, we stayed for the first 5 days here and the location was excellent. It was within only a few minutes walk of the main St. Marco Square with access to all the waterboats and everything, but also tucked away just enough to be out of the way when returning for the night. The front desk staff was amazing as were the housekeepers and breakfast crew. Every front desk attendant spoke English and were very personable, offering tips and advice on places to go and things to do. We would highly recommend this hotel, as the rooms were cozy and recently renovated for a great bed and breakfast/homely feel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiPav
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Noemi - with a large group. The rooms (double standard) were more than adequate, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. There is some noise from the streets below - but thats the norm in small cities - nothing that a pair of ear plugs cant solve. The service was great - very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to make us happy. The location is literally a 2 min walk from San Marco square and in my opinion the best selling point of this hotel! Bravo Hotel Noemi - Im not staying anywhere else if I come to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andrewkn
Reviews.Content: A really clean,comfortable hotel close to St Mark's square;very good breakfast and friendly staff.It gets you into the spirit of Venice.Only disadvantage the small size of the shower.Definitely would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever! Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: sachkanade
Reviews.Content: This is THE worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The reception desk is not on the ground floor, and there are no elevators here. The staff did not help me or my wife with our luggage. I had to tell my wife to leave the bag down so I had to make two trips up for our bags. The reception person wanted to keep our passports, so he could write down a passport number, but he put it in a cubby as if he was going to keep our passports, when we objected, he said "is this the first time you're staying at a hotel?" VERY RUDE! The night reception person was not any better. You have to get a code for their free wi-fi which lasts for an hour. When we clarified that it's free he said "no, it's 10 euros" with a serious face. When we said that we thought it's free, he laughed and eventually gave us the password to use the wi-fi. The next day, we asked for wi-fi access again, and confirmed that it's still free, he said "I told you yesterday that it's free". If you are taking your girl to Venice and want her to cry (not the happy tears), then stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to raise price after booking - Cancelled”
Reviews.Author: JosephJFK
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel, called and spoke with the hotel to provide my credit card, and then afterwards got an email saying that the price had gone up. Very shady. To be clear, I did not stay here, but neither should you.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: CODYCPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with four adult children. The rooms were very nice, the breakfast was very good & generous. The hotel was very quiet & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and cozy with wonderful staff. Great location for exploring.”
Reviews.Author: marcem2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Noemi is a wonderful hidden gem with old world charm with modern facilities. They offer breakfast in the morning with great coffee and fresh pastries. The staff is very helpful and extremely friendly. We traveled with 2 children and the hotel is very welcoming and accommodating. The hotel is situated in a quiet spot only 1 minute walking distance to St. Mark's Square. Bring your walking shoes and also a pair of rubber boots if you come to Venice in November! There is alot to see ( be sure to do some research of the city before traveling) also, there is alot of shopping, good food and wine! We will definitely come back to Venice and stay at the Noemi again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: reallife123
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hotel Noemi for one week. The room I had was very nice and appointed with Italian silk walls, drapery and bedspreads, complimented with antique period furniture. Very nice! The staff was always very friendly and helpful, as we were dealing with Venice's high water while we were there (The hotel is on the second floor, so no problem there). The staff updated us daily on the tide tables and even offered us boots to navigate the streets during the high water. Fun experience! The location of the Hotel Noemi is perfect. When you step out of the hotel you are only a two minute walk to the center of St. Mark's square. Clean, convenient, priced right, and friendly staff. Nobody can ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomodating staff and comfortable facility”
Reviews.Author: jan9705
Reviews.Content: Hotel Noemi's friendly staff was eager to accommodate my family's needs, making our trip to Venice memorable.

Reviews.Title: “small gem”
Reviews.Author: sadie520
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best little hotels you can find in Venice. The room we had was well suited to our needs with a well appointed bath and a large comfortable bed. The kids had their own bed and slept very comfortably. We enjoyed the hotels proximity to St Mark's square, which was only a two minute walk away. This place is the best bang for your buck( or should I say ...Euro).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our "little" room! Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: halifaxfoodknowit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Hotel Noemi. The pictures on the website certainly make the rooms look much bigger than they are. The room was very small, clean and decent. The location couldn't have been beat!!! The walk to San Marco Square was less than a minute, which was a huge bonus considering getting lost in Venice is not fun. Overall great stay~

Reviews.Title: “like in a family”
Reviews.Author: nicolaiVenezia
Reviews.Content: i went there a years ago and decided to bring our best friend ! This time we had a charming venetian oriental red room! And like before was wery clean. This time we had much more to visit so we ask for so many information and Linda was always kynd to help us! They also arrange a free tryp by water taxy to visit MURANO blown glass factory.. it was an amaizing experience! For just 7 euro the breakfast can full your stomac!! fresh bread, fresh cake and croissant, salami cheese, ham yogurt and more! I really want to come back during the carnival!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, small but nicely decorated rooms”
Reviews.Author: iesmail
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the small streets just off St.Marcus Piazza. Rooms are small but very beautiful. The hotel reception is on 1st floor and there is no lift, so be prepared to climb the stairs to your room with your luggage (building is 3-4 floors high)

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Mashalsou
Reviews.Content: The main thing in visiting Venice is theSt.Marco sqr., and that's why we've choose the Noemi Hotel nearby.There is also a great terrace next to the hotel where we were admiringthe piano' playing every evening. The price was cheap and we took 2double rooms. Within 3 days staying there we were treated as kings -the furniture and atmosphere inside was like in a castle of middle ageswith huge beds and mirrors. Awesome fish was in the restaurant. Iconsider this hotel to be an amazing one, but you can say if it's trueor not only if you visit it. Good luck, guys! 

Reviews.Title: “Great Venetian atmosphere in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Liacapri
Reviews.Content: I loved our experience in this hotel. Travelling with my mom, we enjoyed the life in Venice day and night. The location is perfect, the breakfast was fantastic, with fruits, breads, cheeses and cold cuts, cereals and the delicious Italian coffee. The service was fantastic, even so they were under renovation in the first floor. Not recomended for overweighted people or people with limited walking capabilities, the hotel has estairs and the breakfast area is not so spacious.

Reviews.Title: “a great place for Venice' visitors who wants to feel the atmosphere of ancienty and nobleness in it's original style”
Reviews.Author: katiuwa23
Reviews.Content: Recently my friends and i decided to throw away all the routine affairs and to make an EuroTour. Thus we had some troubles with visas, finaly after a long timewasting therapy, we've got them! The italian embassy is to much strict giving visas, so we found another way... We made the Shengen visas in the Hungarian embassy... So, we've been to France, Hungary, Germany and the last station was Italy. For sure, Venice is the best combination of great ancienty and modern facilities. If you want to feel yourself Casanova, then just get the mask from the San Marco sqr. on, take an gondola and a girl and enjoy the view! Just like a friend of mine did! so, why did we chose this hotel? there was only one reason! On our way to the most beautiful square in Venice, the San Marco, we saw a small signboard and decided to come in. Our surprice had no edges, when we saw instead of some inn a great hotel in an ancient style with all the facilities! We were surprised again, when some of us asked "Quanto costa?" and we've got a pleasant answer! the price was not so high! We are students and we apreciated this! Why Not? 2 steps away from the main square, the very centre of Venice, ancient beautiful interior and a pleasant service! And don't be afraid to disturb your neighbours if you're too loud having sex))) 'Cause they won't hear your moan! So, in a nut shell - I RECOMAND!

Reviews.Title: “I advise to everybody who wants for a short while to plunge into the Middle Ages, without feeling thus any discomfort -”
Reviews.Author: Nelks
Reviews.Content: The blue dream of the bewitched fisherwoman has come true. Since the childhood I dreamt to get to a city on water, have read a heap of stories, books and have seen hundreds of video-plots about Venice and at last I have reached it. Couple of days of some explanations with the heads, a week on waiting on visa, a couple of hours of flight and finally I've reached the place..... At first an unusual smell of fish which is, according to explanations, not so fish, it's the smell, if it is possible to say, of the water in channels.... And so in the beginning this smell was making me sober as liquid ammonia, constantly reminding of itself - but after a while you start to find it awesome.... Well, so what I was talking about+ about the hotel: a friend of mine advised it to me and after arrival to Venice - I gave at once the cut-away with the hotel's address to the taxi driver and have shortly said "Via"+ half an hour of admiring the city from the car's window and here we are: entering the hotel you can hear polite "Bon Jorno" and a nice sincere smile, my suitcases were in the room immediately and I just could hardly thrust some euro tips to the porter though he refused flatly to take it, explaining that everything's "bene"... My friend's stories that I can be transferred to the Middle Ages for some time have justified on all of 100 % - a huge classical bed, the Venetian mirrors and the plasma panels with frameworks - in general the interior's in Medici's style, but with all delights of the present. It's located literally two steps away from San Marko square, and coming back in the evenings you can feel yourself so much citizen of this amazing old city that approaching the hotel after walk - it would be desirable to get keys out of your pocket from the door of the palazzo and to open it, I've become so related with this hotel as I felt myself being its part. There was faultless service and cleanliness that was not always met even in Turkey which is famous for the service. I advise to everybody who wants for a short while to plunge into the Middle Ages, without feeling thus any discomfort - it is romantic, beautiful and it's somehow refined in a home-style!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on walk distance to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: oculus_film
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel next to San Marco offered our crew a good rest after a hard-working day shooting a documentary in the Cathedral and a even better start in the morning with the delicious home made brakfast served in a beatiful breakfast room. Rooms are cosy, clean, warm (it was snowing outside!) and really elegant (as the rest of this tiny hotel!). Alvise and Linda were the best hosts we could expect in this really stressful week in Venice! The stay is really worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “vidunderlig”
Reviews.Author: nicolaiVenezia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and sweet venitian looking. The room are very charming with beautiful venitian fabrics on the wall nd very clean. Every small particular is studied with taste. The staff was helpfull and nice. Amazing the location: 20 second from S. mark and 3 min. to Rialto. We enjoed the home made baked cake durilng the breakfast!!! I will suggest this hotel to everbody that like to be cuddle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahviennese
Reviews.Content: Hotel Noemi is definitly a place I would recommand is you want to be close to everything you would/should see in Venice,it benefits from a really nice location.The service is fine and the staff qualified and welcoming.I really appreciate Venice and teh Hotel just made it a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noemi = No service..and do not care”
Reviews.Author: BAREENA
Reviews.Content: Other than position this Hotel does not have much going for it....There was absolutely no greeting on our arrrival...we were their guests...I would not like to see how they treat others...and the receptionist/concierge would have to be the most rudest person one could come across...keys are placed in front of you and you have to make your own way from there. Trying to get help was like pulling teeth!. The room was adequate but with no directions in place for appliances etc...breakfast did not rate much but was at least served with some courtesy...

Reviews.Title: “Noemi put me up at a different and less attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerJZ
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for Hotel Noemi over a month in advance. When I checked in - early afternoon - I was told that they were full, and had moved me to a nearby hotel. That hotel was a run-down, budget hotel - far less attractive than Hotel Noemi. It appears from other reviews that they do this quite frequently. I also had to prove to reception that I had paid in advance through a hotel booking, as they were proposing to charge me again. All in all, an unpleasant experience to start my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: spyl
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for three days. Upon our arrival at midnight, after long delays of our flights with Alitalia, we discovered that the room that we had reserved was not available for us. The employee at the reception said a cheap excuse and offered us to stay in another hotel. We thought that they gave our room because we arrived late, but after a little arguing we decided to check the other hotel. It was terrible and we refused to stay there. The employee was not willing to do anything else and we decided to call the police to settle this. After long arguing he started promising to find us another hotel, pay the difference for extra prize and discount for the next days. However, nothing of this happened. We payed the other hotel and stayed at Noemi with the initial prize. Except the discomfort they caused, the room that we stayed had two single beds with seperated mattresses, collided and not a double bed as we had reserved. The room was clean and nice decorated, but rather small. The bath was also clean, but the bathing foam that they were providing was hardly enough for one shower per day. Breakfast was served in a cosy room, but it was very poor. There is not elevator in the hotel so, we had to carry our baggages by stairs. Our overall experience was bad and i would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gilt treasure and hidden gem in the heart of Venezia”
Reviews.Author: boyattheback
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Noemi Hotel (room 101) in mid July 2007 and it more than lived up to expectations. Set in an excellent location, just 40 seconds or so from St Mark's Square, this is the best and best-located small hotel I've stayed in in this wonderful city. Newly refurbished, clean and elegant with a mix of old and new, this tiny boutique-style hotel comes highly recommended. The staff / manager were professional and friendly; the in-room facilities (shower, flat screen TV, air con) seemed new and were good, and the windows are aluminium framed double-glazing, which not only look good but ensure any noise from the street below is kept to a minimum if not shut out altogether. The breakfast room is small, however, and we had to wait about, ooh, two minutes for a table to become available. For the sake of accuracy I guess I should report that there was a minimal amount of refurbishment work being carried out during our short stay; these were minimal, only to the communal areas and works were not carried out after office hours, so at no point we were inconvenienced in any way whatever. This work appeared to be the final stage of refurbishment. I don't know what it was like before, but the Noemi is now a rather charming and plush little hotel. As for a location, it's hard to beat. I'd have said it's a hidden gem. A word about getting to the Noemi: the hotel website advises you to alight from the vaporetto (water bus) at the Rialto stop (assuming you're travelling down the Grand Canal from the train station) and take a little (even by Venice standards) side street called Calle Bembo, which is the third turning on the left as you walk away from the Rialto Bridge. (Please note, however, that when searching for Calle Bembo, Google Maps came up with another street of the same name elsewhere in the city, so make sure you get the right one!). This tiny alleyway is easy to miss (we did), so just remember that it's directly after a footbridge on the main sidewalk. Then you just follow the lane as it crosses small openings and squares, even when it becomes known by other names. Just when you're starting to think you've missed it, that's when you'll see it. This is the quickest way, but one could stay on board the vaporetto until close to St Mark's Square as the hotel is much close to this point, but the extra time the vaporetto takes ploughing slowly along the Grand Canal makes this option prohibitively long. Perhaps only choose this option if you have a lot of luggage? Photos I took: http://www.flickr.com/photo_zoom.gne?id=908792299&size=o

Reviews.Title: “Worse Stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: MGMMexico
Reviews.Content: The rooms we were assigned upon arrival were not even in the same building as the hotel itself and had nothing to do with the pictures posted in the Hotel's website, were tiny-claustrophobic and not tidy. Also the clerks were extremely rude at the time of checkout and were never hospitable. With so much confusion I forgot a Jacket in the room and called several times in the following days to recover it but no one was ever capable of providing me with any information. With so many options in such a great city, skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute!”
Reviews.Author: Meunica
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel, and I decided to go ahead with it, despite reading some pretty bad reviews on tripadvisor. And we did not regret it. The location is great, the rooms are just as they look on the website, adorable and clean (even if small-ish), the staff was friendly and helpful, so I have almost only positive things to say. There is a potential improvement area though - the breakfast is rather poor, but I think most mid-range hotels in high tourist concentration areas have this flaw. Oh and they saw from the passport my husband has a bday and sent us free champagne to the room :)

Reviews.Title: “Adorable and kitsch”
Reviews.Author: Dreft
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at Hotel Noemi, which my boyfriend arranged. The rooms were rather small, but clean and comfortable (with fabulous decor, hence my review of adorable and kitsch). The location was excellent at only a few minutes walk from San Marco and the staff was friendly enough. A double room cost us 65 euros including taxes and breakfast. This was cheaper than most of the hotels on the Lido, which is not nearly as central! I could recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelarts
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Venice by myself, so I was afraid to pick out a hotel on the internet. I relied on my travel agent, but I wish I would have used my gut feeling and found a different hotel. The Noemi was very overpriced, my room was very tiny (but what bothered me was that it was dark-------one small window with no view!) The desk clerks were not very helpful and were very ready to direct me to overpriced restaurants, internet points, tours, etc. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are so many others to choose from, and being close to St. Mark's Square is not the most important amenity because nothing is that far away.

Reviews.Title: “extremely mediocre, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Wiesner
Reviews.Content: Having gotten the name from Let's Go-Italy, I stayed here 2 nights in June,'03, to be near San Marco. It was a mistake. The hotel is way overpriced, just for location. The narrow alley/street has loud music playing from a convenience store. The room decor was okay, bath okay, but slmply not worth the price. I definitely would not stay her again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Noemi
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 909 | Calle Dei Fabbri, 30124 Venice, Italy
